meanings.definition: Abnormal location or displacement of an organ or body part.
meanings.sent1: The ectopia of the heart caused health issues for the patient.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the ectopia of the kidney in the ultrasound.
meanings.sent3: The ectopia of the liver decided to take a vacation from its usual spot.
meanings.sent4: Her ectopia of thoughts led her to unexpected conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The ectopia of the brain made it hard for him to concentrate.

meanings.definition: A congenital malformation in which an organ is abnormally positioned in the body.
meanings.sent1: The baby's ectopia of the lungs required immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon successfully corrected the ectopia of the stomach in the newborn.
meanings.sent3: The ectopia of the heart in the baby made it look like a little superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her ectopia of dreams took her to magical places every night.
meanings.sent5: The ectopia of the eye made her see the world in a unique way.

meanings.definition: The displacement of an organ or tissue from its normal position.
meanings.sent1: The ectopia of the intestines required surgical intervention.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian treated the ectopia of the cat's tail with care.
meanings.sent3: The ectopia of the lungs decided to explore new horizons in the body.
meanings.sent4: His ectopia of emotions made it hard for him to express himself.
meanings.sent5: The ectopia of the plant's roots symbolized growth and adaptation.
